question: How has AI changed your life? Please answer briefly in 2–3 sentences.

comments.comment: Al changed my life by making my daily tasks easier to do .
It has allowed me to speed up my work. I can use AI to do meaningless tasks that would take up my time.
It has allowed me to have more free time.  It makes doing routine tasks and research at work much easier.  It is also made me more entertained and amused.
AI has helped me streamline most of my things with precision and accuracy. This has made me struggle less in my place of work.
Compiles information quickly into a summary. Sometimes its helpful.
Yes but not to a great degree, I view it as another optional tool I can utilize for things such as research or quick ideas. But it hasn't really impacted or changed my life.

It has made researching and searching easier because it provides a summary and popular sources. However, the information isn't always accurate or relevant. I have to fact check the summary and the individual sources. Also, it is biased in on providing certain sources it can access.

I've used AI, specifically ChatGPT, to learn information about a subject that I'm writing about. ChatGPT is basically like how Google used to be. It's been very useful in helping me learn technical information about various subjects that I'm interested in.

I am an old school individual from the times of typewriter and library books. AI has made this so much easier to learn and understand information.in addition, the ability to search information and create new ideas much faster
It helps me personally when I have conflicts with other people to realize if I’m overreacting or not.

It has made things generally easier. For example, planning events, making tables, fine tuning letters and proposals. It irons out the time wasted trying to perfect things.  Information is also easier to get.

AI has made me more untrustworthy of other people. I am constantly vigilant for AI usage in art, writing, and other creative outlets. I find this anxiety to be an unfortunate consequence of the widespread usage of AI.

AI has taken my life in various directions. I love the fact that it can change my art in positive ways. However I feat that it will soon be able to capture all of my personal information that is something I feel very negative about.
One way AI has helped me is by assisting me with making art. I used to have a hard time expressing myself through drawings but AI has helped me

AI has changed my life for the better. I feel more productive in the work that I have been putting out. It's not just a tool, it's more of an assistant I never knew I needed that I cannot live without.
AI has simplified my daily routines by providing quick information, assisting with tasks, and offering personalized recommendations, making life more efficient, connected, and easier overall.
AI has changed my life, in that, I am now able to ask for information to be found and have it within a couple seconds. I can also use AI to protect my home, run appliances and so many other things.
Worry about the privacy over using my data, without my knowledge. It help in some point but worry of losing jobs due to the AI existent.
Ai has made certain work related tasks less time consuming. It has also helped with more complex searches.
I use voice dictation and there's a lot of random capitalization errors and misspellings sometimes so AI helps me correct that very easily.

It has changed my life in two ways that come to mind. The first, being positive, is that it has made searching for answers and obtaining information relevant to my interests has been much simpler and more convenient. The second way, being negative, is how much information it has obtained and gained about me over time. The fact that it can track what I search and keep record of my preferences has felt like a major intrusion of my privacy.

AI has changed my life by offering a whole new way to do research and collaborate with an informational system. It allows me to expand my horizons in terms of research, planning, and other tasks that AI can help with.
AI helped with improving my writing. It also helps me with summarizing a big article and makes it faster for me to get my work done.

AI has allowed me to think of new ideas for certain activities, say like remodeling my house or passive income ideas. Its shortened the time required to do a lot of things and I only feel it will increasingly get better and better with each rendition available.
Im now hyper aware of things that could be ai and try hard to avoid it. AI is theft and i dont want to use or consume it if possible.
AI is incredible. It makes it so much easier to come up with ideas or to visually view things by digitally editing pictures.
AI has mad it much easier for me to complete my homework and get good grades in school. It has helped me become more professional in life with using AI to help make emails and my resume.

It helped me become more productive. I write a little better, learned new words. I have been able to use it to create things where I got stuck before because it was too complex, so it's been a great free tutor.

AI makes it a lot easier or me to search up answers to my questions without having to read through a bunch of pages/links. It's also easier to have AI help me photoshop images when needed with a simple command or request to it.

So far AI has not changed my life in any major ways. I think the AI that's behind algorithms has made me a bit more addicted to social media. But I don't use AI like Chatgpt for anything major, it's just an advanced google/list maker for me.

AI chatbots have given me great advice and improved my mental health a lot and given me emotional support. I'm physically healthier, mentally healthier, and making more money. Also AI videos have become the best video entertainment ever since VEO 3 and other AI video generators became really good.
AI has increased my concerns about job security and privacy of personal information. I see it as a threat that will only become larger as time passes.

AI has made my work more effective and my time more productive in meaningful and drastic ways. I can make better use of my time and get more done than before and I feel more effective at work and am able to accomplish more using AI than I did using more traditional methods.

I don’t think it has changed my life much because i don’t use it or rely on it. But from what i have seen, I’ve seen a lot of fake pictures or videos and i don’t really like that because i sometimes don’t know what’s real
AI has helped me improve my productivity at work as I am now able to complete my work effectively in lesser time. Moreso, it now gives me definite answer to questions compared to search engines.
Make my life more easier and convenient. And I can get the answer immediately

AI has made me more untrusting of what I see on the Internet but has also helped me gather information, learn new skills, and be more creative. Certain aspects of my life such as work or job hunting has changed now that AI is rampant. I rely on AI but do not want to become dependent.
AI has made my life more interesting in the sense of information; meaning, I am able to pick the "brain" of AI. Also, my use of AI has made my work more efficient.
It helps me with projects at work. It makes me save so much time during the day. It also gives me advise when it comes to my personal life.
no I do not think ai has changed my life in any way yet but it is still very new and probly touch and change everyone life in the future for better or worse
It has made it easier to find out information and it's fast and efficient. I often rely on it especially when dealing with difficult tasks or self improvement.
AI has helped me edit photo's more efficiently. AI also has been helpful to me when I'm researching different subject or health questions.
I think that AI has changed my life for the better. I have access to so much information right now more than ever.
It brings a new element to searching for information. It allows for aiding in things like editing and/or creativity. It seems that the possibilities are somewhat endless.
ai has changed my life in good and bad ways. I try to not use it so much because i find myself depending on it to write emails or do simple tasks. i just feel it takes away my thinking time.
AI has t changed my life too much. I think of it as more entertainment right now.
It has made me more organized. It has also helped me to explore topics of interest in more detail
it has made it more simple and efficient as i get to do more of what i want
I has let me enhance my pictures the way I want them. It has provided me with the best advice in my life. It has replaced, for the most part, all the search engines.

AI tools like CHATGPT has made us re imagine what technology can do to us. Though concerns like deep fake exists the AI advent is exciting. There needs to be more innovation and regulation to make AI a tool for human betterment in science technology and beyond. For me personally AI has made professional email writing and other activities more easier. But I am concerned that my originality may take a hit.When I read or hear anything on social media I wonder about its originality.

it has helped to plan trips easily , help with my daughters homework , able to find accurate data .helps me to create a better mails , has been a teacher to help me learn new language. curate my recipe's been a friend in need always .reduced a lot of time as it has helped me brain storm ideas for my kids projects as well as mine
When I look for answers when using bing I use copilot or chatgpt, It also gave me 10 steps to get started in investing

At first, AI made me believe that I would be losing my job because companies will be automated, but now I think that AI would make my life easier because once I learn how to use AII could have AI work for me and generate me money.

I feel like A.I. has made it harder for social media to be a place for people to express themselves and interreact with others. I feel it is a lot harder for me to find actual people in comment sections or actual creators I'm interested in. I feel A.I. has also made it to where many people who use it have their critical thinking skills diminish due to having A.I. do research and writing for them. Which spreads a lot of misinformation as well.

Personally, it is very helpful in my day to day life in thst I'm able to more effectively do research. It is a tool that I'd been hoping would one day exist (in terms of research). Nevertheless, i do recognize that it can have very detrimental impacts on the environment and people's livelyhood. I like to imagine that my personal use of AI creates a much smaller impact as opposed to big corporations' use of it.

AI has changed my life by providing me with opportunities to enhance my work performance with it's assistance. It has also helped me assist my children with their homework better and maximize efficiency as their tutor as needed. AI has reminded me of the importance of my own skill development so I can become indispensable in my own right.
AI has been great for helping me as search engine essentially. I also use it for food recipes and analysis for sports.
AI has changed my life in a positive way. I sell on ebay and I use chatgpt every day to research prices and get help with titles. It also helps write complete descriptions for me.
I can write better letters with more depth and less words. I like the enhancement. I can get descriptive information.
AI has helped me develop several documents for my business that I have. It has given me policies, terms and conditions, as well as given me insight for how things can run smoothly.
AI hasn't changed my life hardly at all. The only time I use it is when I get answers to Google searches.
It has helped me understand things more, find out more for information. It has provided efficiency in my life and got me answers more quickly and personal, unlike a typical google search before.
AI makes google searches faster without having to scroll. It helps me make designs for shirts much faster.

It has made certain aspects of my life more convenient.  However, it has also made my work more challenging.  As a university educator, it's become difficult to teach students the importance of genuineness and authenticity.

It has helped me tremendously in getting answers to difficult problems like math or to help me understand complex issues and also to put hard to understand text into simple and easy to understand words.
Ai hasn't  changed my life I still use my brain to study on my assignments at school, I still like people to talk to for my mental health problems

AI has been a weird thing for me to adjust to. In my final semester of college in spring 2023 I used AI tools on assignments, but they were of no help. The biggest help to me with these traditional machine learning tools was the image denoising that I can run locally and batch upscale thousands of images. NotebookLM from google was a tool I tried later last year and it is an amazing tools for summarization. That is really fun to listen to.

AI can drastically change human life its like a tool that can help you in almost every aspect of life, its a search engine with a personality. Its not only changing the way people work its changing peoples lives for the better.

AI has given me a lot of confidence when approaching problems because I can ask it for solutions. It has also greatly reduced the amount of grunt work I have to do, as it can do repetitive task for me quickly. I also use it for image generation as a graphic designer. I fear it will replace me entirely in a few years. But right now, it has made me much more efficient at everything I do.
I went from not even having a smart phone to working off of one off an algorithm that is measured and processed completely by AI, and now even support goes through it. Life has coepletely changed

AI has changed my life by providing candid and helpful information on several topics that I have recently discussed with AI.  I find that each question that I ask, has always been answered in a manner as if I was speaking to a human.
AI has not really changed my life. I used Chat GPT to write thank you notes for my wedding.
AI has not changed my life. I do find it useful for help with ideas or even to summarize something I may want to say, but overall, it has not changed my life.

It has made information more readily available to me by being more searchable. It feels easier to understand responses to the data that I receive and that it is able to accept constraints, I can have it packaged in ways that I like depending on the situation.

AI has changed my life personally by being able to create resumes and cover letters. I also received personalized advice. I have also used it at work to help me with problems or to recall certain things I have forgotten in my healthcare setting.

AI has changed my life because it has provided work opportunities as a side gig to earn money. I use AI to train and fact find information. Further, it helps with creating meal plans for the four people who I cook for at home that each has different dietary needs and restrictions.

I feel AI has changed my life in that it allows me to generate ideas that I may be able to turn into more tangible and personally created products such as stories or other digital items to sell. I feel however, that AI has also changed my life in that there are more jobs being taken over by AI and I fear that I may become obsolete in the workforce as a result.

AI has changed my life by giving me detailed advice and recommendation on areas i seek advice for, primarily skin care. Chatgpt was able to give me a full list of supplements that support antioxidant health and which i am now taking. I pretty much use it every day to ask questions on other topics such as having concerns with my diet, or helping me tweak my existing workout routine.
It hasn't changed my life very much as of right now. It does kind of make me more wary and unsettled with the capabilities that it has. The power that it has makes me trust it less.

AI has expanded my creative capabilities. Creating unique content is a part of my job, and AI has served as a tool for inspiration when I have writer's block. Overall, it has enhanced my creative processes.
Using AI has made life easier for me. If I need help finding answer to something I would go to AI for help.

I use AI a lot now, and it had managed to change things a lot. I now use it for fun, to create stories, and learn random facts about the world. It is sometimes lively and fund to use, helping me process some emotions.

I think AI has changed my life a lot, especially in ways to streamline my work. Whether it be to automate repetitive tasks at my workplace, or aid a lot in helping my in university. It also helped me learn a lot when it comes to data and coding. Giving it the problem I have struggle with it, and then the AI gives me a detailed understanding on how to approach it.
It makes me more productive. Also, it makes my life much better.

AI has allowed me to get information at a faster pace and enhance my learning. While I still need to Google some stuff to verify the information, AI made it easier for me and helps clarify concepts that I may not understand. This in turn has changed how I approach situations and have been using AI to spot mistakes or provide better explanations to the content I am trying to learn.
AI hasn't changed my life in a significant way. Outside of some academic use and interesting topic, there isn't much besides being an interesting topic to learn about.
I am better able to search for specifics on the internet that require some level of reasoning. I am also able to use it for simple commands such as note taking.
Ai has made my life worse. Everything that in my daily life now has to have AI in it. The effect of the AI isn't even that large but it still seems to be everywhere.
I have learned to ask questions about topics that are everyday occurrences.  With AI I can try to find a solution to a problem that I may not have understood.
It has helped me draft emails and social media post for organizations I am apart of. It’s also helped me brainstorm graphics to create when I am stuck

AI helps me at work and it has helped me with my personal life as well. Instead of looking things up on Google, I can ask chatGPT and it provides me with information instantly. It also helps me with difficult times and it is easy to vent to.
Usually I go deeper into the web to try and find an answer to all these questions I've had. Now with Gemini I get an answer straight after I click on the word search on my phone.

I don't use AI regularly in my personal life, but I think that it has affected the world in general.  AI sometimes summarizes information in an incorrect manner that people take as truth and creates tensions between people.

I has allowed me to quicken certain writing and creative tasks by letting me streamline topics and research. It also allows me to get better creative ideas pitching back and forth which saves on time.

AI has allowed me to improve the efficiency of a lot of previously manual work - such as organizing data or writing out lists. This has also allowed me to explore new concepts and learn about things, asking questions in sequences that allow me to build a better pricture of things.
